title: Freitas (Augusto César de). F
body: He was a man of rare talent and remarkable literary abilities, who was severely affected by adversity, not allowing his intellectual gifts to shine and be appreciated as they truly deserved. We know little about his biography, despite being a contemporary figure. We know that he was a primary education teacher and dedicated himself to journalism, revealing remarkable writing qualities. In Funchal, he was the editor of Noticioso and Paiz, and in Lisbon, he collaborated with Parlamento, Conservador, and Monitor Portuguez, alongside the leading journalists, as attested by a contemporary witness. He was a colleague in the editorial team of Revolução de Setembro, with our first journalist António Rodrigues de Sampaio, who greatly appreciated him. He died abandoned in a hospital bed on December 21, 1874.

Funchal: Location where he was the editor of Noticioso and Paiz
Lisboa: Location where he collaborated with Parlamento, Conservador, and Monitor Portuguez

Augusto César de Freitas: He was a man of rare talent and remarkable literary abilities, dedicating himself to journalism and revealing remarkable writing qualities

1874: Death of Augusto César de Freitas
